articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Bier of Kang Ki Sop
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Bier of Kang Ki Sop
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, Sunday visited the bier of Kang Ki Sop, alternate member of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and general director of the General Administration of Civil Aviation, to express profound condolences over his death.
					 A wreath from respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un was seen standing before the bier.
					
					 Kim Jong Un paid silent tribute to Kang Ki Sop, revolutionary soldier who not only fulfilled an important flight duty in a responsible manner after growing up to be a competent flight guiding official thanks to the particular trust and loving care of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il but also successfully ensured the operation of the international and domestic regular air service and thus raised the international prestige of the Party and state and made a great contribution to developing the nation's air transport.
					
					 He looked round the bier of Kang Ki Sop.
					
					 He met with family members of the deceased to express condolences over his death.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Myong Su, Pak Yong Sik, Kim Yong Su and Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kang Ki Sop
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kang Ki Sop
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un Sunday sent a wreath to the bier of Kang Ki Sop, alternate member of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and general director of the General Administration of Civil Aviation who is winner of Order of Kim Il Sung and DPRK Hero, expressing deep condolence over his death.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Inspects Taekwon-Do Hall
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Inspects Taekwon-Do Hall
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, vice-chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, made a field survey of the Taekwon-Do Hall now under renovation.
					 Going round different places of the construction site, he encouraged the builders to register signal successes in the renovation project.
					
					 He took measures for improving the quality of renovation work to successfully ensure the 20th World Taekwon-Do Championships, and for finishing the project at an early date.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Germany Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Germany Appointed
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Pak Nam Yong was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Germany, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: New Chairman of DPRK Olympic Committee Appointed
articles.content:
New Chairman of DPRK Olympic Committee Appointed
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Il Guk, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, was appointed as chairman of the DPRK Olympic Committee at its general meeting held in Pyongyang Monday.

articles.title: 22nd Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions Opens
articles.content:
22nd Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions Opens
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The 22nd Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions was opened with due ceremony at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street here on Monday to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The contest is to be held at Kim Il Sung Stadium, Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street, Meari Shooting Gallery and other places till February 14, divided into four groups. Its participants will compete in such events as basketball, volleyball, badminton, Taekwon-do, shooting and tug of war and sporting and amusement games.

articles.title: New Technology for Biomass Raw Materials Established in DPRK
articles.content:
New Technology for Biomass Raw Materials Established in DPRK
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The State Nanotechnology Bureau in the DPRK has established a technology for pyrolyzing and liquefying biomass raw materials.
					 According to Sok Chung Ryol, vice-director of the bureau, the technology was introduced into the Pyongyang Rice-cleaning Factory.
					
					 The biological binding material can be used in metallurgical industry instead of imported heavy oil and pitch and the activated pyroligneous acid in organic farming, medical science, stockbreeding, fish farming, foodstuff and other sectors.
					
					 The charcoal can be used in making activated charcoal. 
					
					 The effectiveness of biological binding material and activated pyroligneous acid has been proved in different sectors of national economy.

articles.title: Synthetic Grass Production Process Established in DPRK
articles.content:
Synthetic Grass Production Process Established in DPRK
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The Plasticization Institute in the DPRK has established a new process of producing synthetic grass, thus opening up a bright prospect for mass-producing it with indigenous technology and efforts.
					 The institute conceived a process of producing grass thread on the basis of extrusion drawing and heat treatment method and settled sci-tech problems arising in providing an optimum processing condition for grass thread production.
					
					 It also succeeded in developing a combined control system by putting all the production processes on a streamlined basis.
					
					 According to Rim Chang Ho, director of the institute, the synthetic grass is equal to natural grass in the elastic modulus of balls and its technical indices reach the quality standard set by the FIFA.

articles.title: Greening Work Brisk in Ryomyong Street
articles.content:
Greening Work Brisk in Ryomyong Street
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- A greening work is progressing apace at the construction site of Ryomyong Street, the DPRK.
					 Apartments and public buildings have been turned into green buildings.
					
					 Turf and trees have been managed in rooftops and other spaces of the buildings and more than 20 kinds of saplings are being planted in the street.
					
					 Planting of turf and trees in surroundings of apartments and public buildings covering tens of thousands of square meters was completed.
					
					 The drive for building hydroponic greenhouses on roofs of nurseries, kindergartens and other public buildings is being stepped up.

articles.title: Chongryon Officials Back Appeal of Joint Conference of DPRK Government, Political Parties and Bodies
articles.content:
Chongryon Officials Back Appeal of Joint Conference of DPRK Government, Political Parties and Bodies
Tokyo, January 21 (KNS-KCNA) -- Officials of organizations of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) made public a statement on Jan. 20 in support of the appeal of the joint conference of the government, political parties and social organizations of the DPRK.
					 Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, expressed the will to make positive efforts to carry out the line and policies of independent reunification full of genuine patriotism, bearing in mind the great pride and self-esteem that the Korean nation is the best, in hearty response to the appeal of the joint conference.
					
					 Ri Jong Man, managing director of the Standing Council of the Korean Federation of Workers in Commerce in Japan, expressed the will to make a positive contribution to making this year a meaningful year of opening up a new phase in independent reunification in hearty response to the appeal.
					
					 Kim Yong Ju, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, said all the officials of the youth league and Korean young people in Japan supported the appeal as a patriotic proposal reflecting the firm will of all the fellow countrymen for national reunification.
					
					 Ryang Ok Chul, vice-chairwoman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, said: We will turn out in the struggle for realizing the appeal without fail and demonstrate the indomitable spirit of the Korean women in Japan in the sacred struggle to wipe out the Park Geun Hye group of traitors.

articles.title: Chongryon Officials Renew Their Will to Work Hard for National Reunification
articles.content:
Chongryon Officials Renew Their Will to Work Hard for National Reunification
Tokyo, January 22 (KNS-KCNA) -- Officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on Jan. 21 made public statements in support of the appeal adopted at the joint conference of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK. 
					 Ri Thae Il, chairman of the Central Standing Management Board of the Korean Youth Commercial Association in Japan, said he received the appeal adopted at the joint conference for implementing tasks for national reunification put forward by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address as the action programme of the nation and fully supported it.
					
					 The Central Standing Management Board will mobilize all its organizations so that all members may vigorously take part in the drive for national reunification this year and make tangible contributions to opening up a broad avenue to independent reunification, he added.
					
					 Ri Yong Su, chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, expressed the will of all the members of the association to work hard to usher in a new phase for independent reunification in this significant year.
					
					 Kim Jong Su, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Writers and Artists in Japan, declared that the union members will turn out in the drive for independent reunification in the spirit for opening up the second June 15 era this year and successfully discharge the mission for the country and the nation.
					
					 Kim Hyon Il, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Students in Japan, expressed the will to be the standard bearer in the drive for glorifying this year as a significant year of ushering in a new phase for independent reunification and fully supported the struggle of south Korean youth and students for independence and national reunification against the U.S.

articles.title: U.S. Arms Buildup Brings Tension: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
U.S. Arms Buildup Brings Tension: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- A fresh tension has been created in the Asia-Pacific region from the outset of the new year due to the U.S. 
					 In the wake of deploying sophisticated F-35B stealth fighters in its military base in Japan, the U.S. decided to dispatch B-1B strategic bombers and F-22 stealth fighters to its air-force base in Australia.
					
					 It is the first time that F-35B has been put on permanent standby overseas by the U.S. It is planning to expand the radius of the operation of F-35B in Northeast Asia, notably moving the matrix port of assault landing ship mounted with those fighters to the southern area of Japan from the U.S. mainland next year.
					
					 In the wake of paving a way for the deployment of multi-purpose modern SM-6 missiles in areas of south Korea, Japan and Australia, Washington also clarified that it would send ultra-modern high-performance early warning plane E-2D Hawk Eye to Japan. 
					
					 This indiscriminate arms buildup of the U.S. has sparked off serious concern of the international community as it is a dangerous act of harassing peace and stability not only on the Korean peninsula but also in the rest of Asia-Pacific.
					
					 The main purpose of the U.S. pivot to Asia-Pacific strategy is to contain and deter big regional powers and establish its domination in reliance on military upper-hand and nuclear edge.
					
					 It is in pursuance of this strategy that the majority of the U.S. strategic nuclear force has been concentrated on Asia-pacific and the region is witnessing the establishment of the triad nuclear carrier system, improvement of performance of already-deployed strategic nuclear bombers and nuclear missiles, and development and deployment of high-output laser artillery pieces, unmanned tactical vehicles and ultra-fast strike weapons.
					
					 Triangular military "cooperation" among the U.S., Japan and south Korea has also been boosted.
					
					 The U.S. is describing its "alliance" with south Korea and Japan as "cornerstone" and "core axis" of its Asia-Pacific strategy and using them as a shock brigade in executing its strategy.
					
					 Shortly ago, an American political commentator in an article said that the U.S. Asia policy orientation depends on Trump doctrine.
					
					 He continued that the truth of return to Asia policy was disclosed during the Obama administration but the U.S. had worked under concrete plan to form a triangular military alliance with Japan and south Korea since several decades ago.
					
					 The U.S. claims the alliance is to tackle nuclear threat from north Korea but the essence is to use Japan and south Korea for realizing its strategy of domination over neighboring countries and several regions in the world, he said, adding that if Japan is a suitable location for the armed forces of the three services of the U.S., south Korea is the only base for its ground force to set its foot in the Asian continent and that the U.S. forces present in south Korea is targeting other forces in the Asian continent from every aspect, not just to cope with nuclear threat from north Korea.
					
					 The tripartite military "cooperation" is also being expanded as part of the second-phase process of the Asia-Pacific rebalancing strategy.
					
					 The U.S. facilitated signing of an agreement on protection of military intelligence between south Korea and Japan under the pretext of "nuclear and missile threats from the DPRK" and allowed establishment of Aegis naval missile shield linking the U.S. and Japan and the overseas dispatch of the Japan "Self-defence Forces".
					
					 The U.S. is stepping up the arms buildup to realize its Asia-Pacific strategy while spreading the story of "threat" from someone but it can never cover up its criminal intention.
					
					 The situation clearly proves that peace and security on the Korean peninsula situated in Asia-Pacific, Northeast Asia to be specific, present themselves as a very important international issue.
					
					 Countries need to heighten vigilance against the ill-boding arms buildup of the U.S.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Scramble among Regional Powers for Sphere of Influence
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on Scramble among Regional Powers for Sphere of Influence
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The situation remains very tense in Northeast Asia.
					 The political and military stand-off is growing ever more acute between China and Japan, in particular.
					
					 On Jan. 9 several Chinese fighters and those of the "Self-Defense Forces" of Japan flew close to each other in the air over the Strait of Tsushima.
					
					 These encounters of fighters of the two countries pushed the situation in the region to a touch-and go-situation.
					
					 As regards Japan's protest against the above-said incident, the Chinese military clarified its stand that it is a "routine drill" and "Japan seems to be not accustomed to such drill as the Chinese People's Liberation Army conducts a few similar rehearsals."
					
					 The Chinese side openly claims that "China may go as it pleases and there is no need to discuss with Japanese what it does there." 
					
					 Japan does not hide the fact that it targets China, stepping up its moves for militarization after building legal and institutional mechanisms for meeting the requirements of a "war state." 
					
					 The U.S. is becoming evermore undisguised in its provocative military moves to contain China politically and militarily in the region.
					
					 It has deployed the bulk of its strategic nuclear force in the region pursuant to its scenario for dominating Asia-Pacific. It is putting spurs to rounding off the triangular military "cooperation" involving the U.S., south Korea and Japan and its arms buildup.
					
					 Owing to the above-said moves, the situation in Northeast Asia is inching close to such dangerous phase that a nuclear war may break out and rendering the arms race in the region fiercer.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that the tension is escalating in the region not because of the DPRK's measures for bolstering up its capability for self-defence but due to the U.S. provocative muscle flexing and scramble among regional powers for sphere of influence in the region.
					
					 The on-going scramble is not comparable with the conflict in the last century due to the persistence of the strategies and the level of the modern forces involved.
					
					 Whenever the DPRK took a measure for self-defence, some countries demanded any action deteriorating the situation be halted as if something serious happened. Now they had better find logical words to say.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Puppet Regime's Dependence on Outsiders
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Puppet Regime's Dependence on Outsiders
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Riff-raffs of south Korean political circles flew into the U.S. to take part in the presidential inauguration of Trump, though south Korea is in the grip of serious mayhem caused by the worst scandal of traitor Park Geun Hye.
					 Feeling uneasy about whether the U.S. policy towards the DPRK would not change after Trump takes office, they implored for keeping "cooperation in pressurizing the north" and vied with each other to shamelessly flatter their American master.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is nothing but servile behaviors of pro-U.S. lackeys and wicked sycophants who are working hard to prolong their remaining days with the help of the U.S., the chieftain of aggression and plunder, which has inflicted all sorts of misfortune and sufferings upon the Koreans. These quislings turned down the good offer of the compatriots in the north to improve the inter-Korean ties and open up a broad avenue to independent reunification by concerted efforts of Koreans.
					
					 The commentary ridicules the south Korean puppet mandarins for vying with each other to flatter the new U.S. president in a bid to weather the political crisis and gratify their political greed with his backing.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 What the puppet politicians must never forget is that those pro- American lackeys met a miserable end without exception for desperately pursuing the confrontation with the compatriots in the north in reliance upon outsiders, rejecting cooperation between fellow countrymen. 
					
					 The commentary calls for not pardoning the traitors keen on stifling the DPRK but severely punishing them.

articles.title: 13th All-People Actions Staged across S. Korea
articles.content:
13th All-People Actions Staged across S. Korea
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- There took place the 13th all-people actions throughout south Korea on Jan. 21 under the sponsorship of the emergency people's action to oust the Park Geun Hye regime, according to press reports of south Korea.
					Involved in them were at least 353,000 workers, peasants, merchants, school youth and children and company employees.
					
					 There took place a candlelight rally "Day of the 13th all-people actions for ousting Park Geun Hye at once and impeaching her as soon as possible" in Kwanghwamun plaza, Seoul.
					
					 Similar actions were simultaneously staged in other parts of south Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean Lawyers, Law Professors and Researchers Protest Puppet Judicature for Patronizing Tycoon
articles.content:
S. Korean Lawyers, Law Professors and Researchers Protest Puppet Judicature for Patronizing Tycoon
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean online papers Thongil News and Jaju Sibo said that south Korean lawyers, law professors and researchers launched a sit-in strike in Seoul on Jan. 20 in protest against the puppet judicature blocking the arrest of the big businessman who committed corruption.
					 There took place a news conference before the stay-in strike, where the speakers said that the bribery by Ri Jae Yong, vice-chairman of the Samsung Electronics, meant an unjust request for reward.
					
					 The emergency people's action to oust Park Geun Hye regime said that the true colors of the court and police were clearly revealed as they abused their power to protect the privileged circles.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Demand NA Opt to Check THAAD Deployment
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Demand NA Opt to Check THAAD Deployment
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The Songju Committee for Struggle against THAAD Deployment, the Kimchon Citizens Measure Committee against THAAD Deployment and the Songju Emergency Measure Committee for Defending Holy Land of Won Buddhism reportedly held a press conference on Jan. 20 and slammed the puppet National Assembly for turning blind eyes to the move for the THAAD deployment.
					 The organizations said that the people urged the opposition parties to adopt the opposition to THAAD deployment as their party stand, check the forcible promotion of the deployment and urgently form a special committee for it at the NA.
					
					 However, the opposition parties did nothing to this end, the organizations noted. 
					
					 The organizations demanded the NA opt to take a practical action to halt the regime's politics of not seeking people's understanding.

articles.title: All-People Struggle Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
All-People Struggle Declared in S. Korea
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean online paper OhmyNews said that the South Kyongsang Provincial Headquarters of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally in Changwon on Jan. 21, where it declared an all-people struggle.
					 The organization at the rally said that the south Korean people offered resistance to the Park Geun Hye regime last year as it resorted to tyranny against democracy, public welfare, peace and reunification, adding so she is facing an impeachment and the "Saenuri Party" is doomed to its dissolution.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Figure of Regional Body
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Figure of Regional Body
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Helmi El Hadidi, chairman of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization, issued a statement on Jan. 11 in support of the New Year Address made by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					 He noted Kim Jong Un said in his New Year Address that the DPRK should concentrate its efforts on implementing the five-year strategy for national economic development. 
					
					 He said Kim Jong Un called upon the whole nation to pool their will and efforts to usher in a heyday of the nationwide reunification movement and frustrate the challenges of the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad who go against the aspiration of the nation for reunification.
					
					 He pointed out that Kim Jong Un stressed that the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government will remain committed to the idea of our foreign policy--independence, peace and friendship, expand and develop the relations of good-neighborliness, friendship and cooperation with those countries championing independence, and make concerted efforts with them to ensure genuine international justice in the future, too.
					
					 He extended full support to Kim Jong Un's New Year Address illuminating the road ahead of not only the Korean people but also the world peace-loving people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Studied in Guinea and Angola
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Studied in Guinea and Angola
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- There took place in Guinea and Angola from Jan. 6 to 11 a meeting of reading and explaining the New Year Address of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					 The chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association said that Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address reviewed the praiseworthy achievements made by the Korean people last year and set forth the tasks for this year. He went on:
					
					 The miracles and innovations being created in the DPRK one after another are instilling conviction into the world progressives and making the imperialist reactionaries uneasy and tremble with fear.
					
					 I wish the Korean people greater success this year, too.
					
					 Figures of the Ministry of Public Health of Angola said:
					
					 Under the wise leadership of HE Kim Jong Un, the DPRK emerged as a fully-fledged nuclear power and its people are smiling a happy smile.
					
					 Every sentence of his New Year Address is full of warm love for the people. So, the Korean people are revering and following him.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Russian Political Party and Guinean Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Russian Political Party and Guinean Organization
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- A Russian political party and a Guinean organization issued statements on Jan. 5 and 9 in support of the New Year Address made by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					 The Political Executive Committee of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia said that it was deeply studying Kim Jong Un's New Year Address.
					
					 It noted that last year the DPRK invariably adhered to the socialist line of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. It went on:
					
					 The Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea marked a historic occasion in the struggle of the Korean people for building socialism, developing economy and bolstering up the defense capabilities.
					
					 The DPRK made miracles and innovations in all sectors of the national economy and the militant might of the Korean People's Army increased in every way despite the imperialists' persistent moves to block the advance of socialism.
					
					 We support the socialist line of the DPRK and believe that the Korean people will successfully implement the tasks set forth by Comrade Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address.
					
					 The Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea fully supported Kim Jong Un's New Year Address, adding:
					
					 We urge the south Korean authorities not to aggravate the situation, finding fault with the DPRK's exercise of the right to self-defence, but to respond to its sincere efforts for preventing military conflict between the north and the south and removing the danger of war and discontinue arms buildup and war drills.
					
					 Well aware of the will of the Korean nation to reunify its country, the United States must no longer cling to the scheme of whipping up national estrangement by inciting the anti-reunification forces in south Korea to confrontation with the fellow countrymen and to war. It must make a courageous decision to roll back its anachronistic policy hostile towards the DPRK.
					
					 We are convinced that the whole Korean nation will open up a broad avenue to independent reunification through its concerted effort this year marking the 45th anniversary of the historic July 4 joint statement and the 10th anniversary of the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il to Be Celebrated in Nigeria
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il to Be Celebrated in Nigeria
Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- A Nigerian national preparatory committee for celebrating the 75th birth anniversary of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was formed in Abuja on Jan. 11.
					 Ibrahim Mantu, member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria and chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events such as a meeting and film show for praising the revolutionary career and exploits of leader Kim Jong Il and to give wide publicity to the successes made by the army and people of the DPRK in defending the country's sovereignty and building a socialist power on this anniversary.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un expresa condolencias por el deceso de Kang Ki Sop
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un expresa condolencias por el deceso de Kang Ki Sop
Pyongyang, 23 de enero (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, expreso el dia 22 las profundas condolencias ante el feretro del difunto Kang Ki Sop, miembro suplente del Comite Central del PTC, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema y director general de Aviacion Civil.
					Ante el feretro del finado estaba colocada una ofrenda floral enviada por el Maximo Dirigente.
					
					El Maximo Dirigente guardo un momento de silencio en memoria del soldado revolucionario quien al crecerse como competente funcionario de direccion aeronautica bajo la especial confianza y amor del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il cumplio satisfactoriamente con la importante mision de aviacion, elevo el prestigio exterior del Partido y el Estado al asegurar con exito la operacion regular internacional y nacional e hizo gran aporte al desarrollo del transporte aereo del pais.
					
					Luego de recorrer el feretro, el se reunio con los familiares del difunto para expresarles el gran pesame y consuelo.
					
					En la visita de condolencia participaron tambien Hwang Pyong So, Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Myong Su, Pak Yong Sik, Kim Yong Su y Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante el feretro de Kang Ki Sop
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante el feretro de Kang Ki Sop
Pyongyang, 23 de enero (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un envio el dia 22 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Kang Ki Sop, miembro suplente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC y director general de la Aviacion Civil, laureado con la Orden Kim Il Sung y heroe de la RPDC, en senal de profundas condolencias por su deceso.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae recorre el Palacio de Taekwondo
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae recorre el Palacio de Taekwondo
Pyongyang, 23 de enero (ACNC) -- Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y del Comite Central del PTC, averiguo en el terreno como marcha la remodelacion del Palacio de Taekwondo.
					Recorriendo varios puntos del campo de construccion, Choe estimulo a los constructores que registran cada dia exitos laborales.
					
					Para auspiciar con exito el 20o Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo, tomo las medidas destinadas a elevar la calidad de la arquitectura y terminar pronto la obra de remodelacion.

articles.title: Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en Alemania
articles.content:
Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en Alemania
Pyongyang, 23 de enero (ACNC) -- Segun el decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Nam Yong fue nombrado como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario coreano en la Republica Federal de Alemania.

articles.title: Elegido nuevo presidente del Comite Olimpico de Corea
articles.content:
Elegido nuevo presidente del Comite Olimpico de Corea
Pyongyang, 23 de enero (ACNC) -- En la asamblea general del Comite Olimpico de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, sesionada este lunes en esta capital, el ministro de Deportes Kim Il Guk fue elegido como nuevo presidente del mismo comite.

articles.title: Inaugurada 22a competencia deportiva de funcionarios de organos centrales
articles.content:
Inaugurada 22a competencia deportiva de funcionarios de organos centrales
Pyongyang, 23 de enero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, quedo inaugurada la 22a Competencia Deportiva por el Premio Paektusan de los funcionarios de los organos centrales que tendra lugar hasta el 14 de febrero en el Estadio Kim Il Sung, el Centro de Baloncesto de la capitalina Avenida Chongchun, el Centro de Tiro Meari y otros lugares.
					En la cita deportiva se desarrollaran divididos en 4 grupos los partidos de baloncesto, voleibol, badminton, Taekwondo, tiro, lucha de cuerda y los juegos deportivos y de recreo.
					
					La ceremonia inaugural tuvo lugar el dia 23 en el Centro de Baloncesto de la capitalina Avenida Chongchun.

articles.title: Aumento armamentista de EE.UU. genera nueva tension: comentario de ACNC
articles.content:
Aumento armamentista de EE.UU. genera nueva tension: comentario de ACNC
Pyongyang, 23 de enero (ACNC) -- Por culpa de EE.UU., se crea nueva tension en la region de Asia-Pacifico desde el principio de este ano.
					Luego de haber emplazado en su base militar en Japon los ultramodernos cazas Stealth F-35B, EE.UU. decidio enviar a la base aerea en Australia el bombardero estrategico B-1B y los cazas Stealth F-22.
					
					Es la primera vez que se desplegaran permanentemente en ultramar los F-35B.
					
					Como parte del plan de ampliar el teatro operacional de esos cazas en el Nordeste Asiatico, el puerto motriz del buque de desembarco para asalto, cargado de los mismos, se trasladara el ano proximo al sur de Japon desde el territorio estadounidense.
					
					Ademas, el imperio abrio las posibilidades de ubicar el misil multiproposito ultramoderno SM-6 en el Sur de Corea, Japon, Australia y otras partes y anuncio la decision de despachar a Japon E-2D Hawk Eye.
					
					El desenfrenado aumento armamentista de EE.UU. causa seria preocupacion de la comunidad internacional porque destruye la paz y estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y el resto de Asia-Pacifico.
					
					La esencia de su estrategia de dar enfoque a Asia-Pacifico consiste en tomar la hegemonia al doblegar y mantener a raya a las potencias regionales con la superioridad militar y la nuclear.
					
					En virtud de ella, se concentran en la region la abrumadora mayoria de las fuerzas nucleares estrategicas de EE.UU.
					
					Al mismo tiempo, marchan en etapa crucial en la region el establecimiento del sistema de 3 flotillas de portaaviones nucleares, el mejoramiento de las especificaciones de bombarderos nucleares estrategicos y misiles nucleares ya desplegados y el desarrollo y ubicacion del canon laser de alta potencia, carros tacticos no tripulados y armamentos de ataque ultra-rapidos.
					
					Por otra parte, se amplia la "cooperacion" militar tripartita entre EE.UU., Japon y el Sur de Corea.
					
					EE.UU. usa la "alianza" con Japon y el Sur de Corea en el cumplimiento de su estrategia describiendola como "piedra angular" y "eje principal" de la estrategia sobre Asia-Pacifico.
					
					Hace poco, un comentarista norteamericano de asuntos politicos opino en su articulo que el rumbo de la politica sobre Asia de EE.UU. depende de la doctrina de Trump.
					
					El continuo que si bien la politica de retorno a Asia se ha perfilado durante la administracion Obama, EE.UU. comenzo a actuar desde varias decadas con un plan detallado para formar la alianza militar tripartita con Japon y el Sur de Corea.
					
					En opinion de EE.UU., esta alianza es para hacer frente a la amenaza nuclear del Norte de Corea, pero lo esencial esta en utilizar a dos aliados asiaticos en el cumplimiento de su estrategia de dominar varias zonas del mundo, revelo.
					
					Japon es el lugar ideal para el estacionamiento de las fuerzas terrestres, navales y aereas de EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea es la unica base de las fuerzas terrestres pegada al continente asiatico, preciso y agrego que las tropas norteamericanas en suelo surcoreano no sirven para enfrentarse a la amenaza nuclear del Norte de Corea sino tienen en su mira a otras fuerzas del continente asiatico.
					
					Actualmente, se amplia la "cooperacion" militar trilateral en el proceso de la segunda etapa de la "estrategia de reequilibrio de Asia-Pacifico".
					
					Como parte de ello, EE.UU. forzo al Sur de Corea y Japon a firmar el acuerdo de proteccion de informaciones militares bajo el pretexto de la "amenaza de armas nucleares y misiles" de la RPDC y permitio al pais isla establecer el sistema de defensa de misiles navales Aegis EE.UU.-Japon y despachar a ultramar las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa".
					
					No se puede ocultar de ninguna manera su intento criminal aunque el imperio acelera el aumento armamentista para cumplir su estrategia de Asia-Pacifico difundiendo el rumor de "amenaza" de alguien.
					
					La realidad comprueba que es un problema internacional muy importante garantizar la paz y seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana, situada en Asia-Pacifico, especificamente, en el Nordeste Asiatico.
					
					Los paises del mundo deberan redoblar la vigilancia ante el sospechoso aumento armamentista de EE.UU.
